Class Boss

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.Group
com.example.demo.actors.Actor.Actor
com.example.demo.actors.Actor.Boss
All Implemented Interfaces:
Destructible, javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
public class Boss extends Actor
Represents the Boss enemy in the game. The Boss has health, a shield, and a predefined move pattern. It can shoot projectiles, summon shields, and play animations upon destruction.

  • Property Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • Boss

      public Boss(javafx.scene.Group root, LevelParent level)
      Constructs a Boss instance with specified root group and parent level.
      Parameters:
      root - The root group to which the Boss belongs.
      level - The parent level of the Boss.

  • Method Details

    • initializeHealthBar

      private void initializeHealthBar()
      Initializes the health bar for the Boss. Sets up the ProgressBar and positions it above the Boss.

    • updateActor

      public void updateActor(double deltaTime, LevelParent level)
      Updates the Boss's state during each frame. Handles movement, shooting, and shield positioning.
      Specified by:
      updateActor in class Actor
      Parameters:
      deltaTime - The time elapsed since the last update (in seconds).
      level - The parent level of the Boss.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damage)
      Inflicts damage on the Boss. If a shield is active and not destroyed, damage is bypassed. Otherwise, the Boss takes damage and the health bar is updated.
      Specified by:
      takeDamage in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      takeDamage in class Actor
      Parameters:
      damage - The amount of damage to inflict.

    • setOnExplosionFinished

      public void setOnExplosionFinished(Runnable onExplosionFinished)
      Sets a callback to be executed after the Boss's explosion animation finishes.
      Parameters:
      onExplosionFinished - The callback to execute.

    • updateHealthBar

      private void updateHealthBar()
      Updates the health bar to reflect the Boss's current health. Ensures that UI updates occur on the JavaFX Application Thread.

    • stopShieldTimeline

      public void stopShieldTimeline()
      Stops the timeline responsible for periodically checking and summoning shields.

    • initializeShieldCheck

      private void initializeShieldCheck()
      Initializes the timeline that periodically checks if the Boss needs to summon a shield. The Boss attempts to summon a shield every 10 seconds if no active shield exists.

    • summonShield

      public void summonShield()
      Summons a shield to protect the Boss. Ensures that only one shield is being summoned at a time.

    • initializeMovePattern

      private void initializeMovePattern()
      Initializes the movement pattern for the Boss. The pattern consists of alternating vertical velocities to create a back-and-forth motion.

    • getNextMove

      private int getNextMove()
      Retrieves the next move in the move pattern. Shuffles the pattern after a certain number of consecutive moves to vary the Boss's movement.
      Returns:
      The next vertical velocity for the Boss.

    • destroy

      public void destroy()
      Destroys the Boss, triggering an explosion animation and executing the onExplosionFinished callback. Ensures that the Boss is only destroyed once.
      Specified by:
      destroy in interface Destructible
      Overrides:
      destroy in class Actor

    • updatePosition

      public void updatePosition()
      Updates the Boss's position based on its movement component and move pattern. Prevents the Boss from moving outside the visible screen bounds.
      Overrides:
      updatePosition in class Actor
